top_categories.workout_context: Vuelta Altas Cumbres’s argentine andes, south american gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Vuelta Altas Cumbres rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Racing Vuelta Altas Cumbres isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Vuelta Altas Cumbres when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Vuelta Altas Cumbres’s argentine andes mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 100 miles, Vuelta Altas Cumbres punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Vuelta Altas Cumbres. Make this intensity feel like home.
Every session at Vuelta Altas Cumbres intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Vuelta Altas Cumbres’s 12,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Vuelta Altas Cumbres — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Vuelta Altas Cumbres’s argentine andes mountain gravel delivers on race day.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Vuelta Altas Cumbres’s 12,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Vuelta Altas Cumbres’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Vuelta Altas Cumbres with 12,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Vuelta Altas Cumbres demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride argentine andes mountain gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: argentine andes, south american gravel, regional event. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of argentine andes mountain gravel in Córdoba, Argentina.
